title: Round, but not too cute slab serif?
content:
I like The Serif Bold, but am looking to use in a job that needs a bit more of a ’friendly’ feel. Some of the Underware fonts look really nice, but are just too cutesy for my needs. Any ideas? Thanks!

 [‹ Script font for large format posters.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408022447/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34535 "Go to previous forum topic") [type taboo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408022447/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34401 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hungryghost

comments.content:
Have a look at Parry, from Ourtype.  
Go to:  
 [http://www.ourtype.be/home.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408022447/http:/www.ourtype.be/home.htm "http://www.ourtype.be/home.htm")  
and then navigate to Parry.

Thanks John, some nice fonts there. Anyone know what font is used on the Autodesk logo?  
 [http://usa.autodesk.com/adsk/servlet/home?siteID=123112&id=129446](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408022447/http:/usa.autodesk.com/adsk/servlet/home?siteID=123112&id=129446 "http://usa.autodesk.com/adsk/servlet/home?siteID=123112&id=129446")

I thought it was some form of [Chaparral](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408022447/http:/www.linotype.com/44236/chaparral-family.html) at first, but the k and the A aren’t quite right. Maybe they had it customised?
Thanks everyone for the replies, Vigor does look pretty damn close!
Thanks everyone for the replies, I think Vigor looks the closest!
